definition: Mohist School of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC), founded by the philosopher 墨子[Mo4 zi3]
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead
surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Therefore, "Poems"has certain influence on the Mohist school thinking formation of politics.
sentences.chinese: 《詩》對墨家政治思想的形成產生了一定的影響。

sentences.english: Moism has a high status and makes remarkable contributions to the development of science and culture in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 墨家在中國科學文化史上的地位與貢獻是多方面的。

sentences.english: Fallacy theory is an important constituent of Mohist school's logic.
sentences.chinese: 謬誤論是墨家邏輯的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Then Mozi's universal love is just blind talking?
sentences.chinese: 那墨家的兼愛豈不就是騙人騙己嗎？

sentences.english: Mozi is the collection of Moist writings of the Warring States Period.
sentences.chinese: 《墨子》是戰國時期墨家著作的總集。

sentences.english: Can the Mohist swordsmen pull together to help Mohists survive the greatest crisis since its emergence?
sentences.chinese: 衆高手能否齊心協力撐過墨家有史以來最大的危機？

sentences.english: In chapter one , we mainly introduce the appearance of Mohist School's education.
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要介紹墨家教育的出現。

sentences.english: Is that what you Mozi would have done sanely?
sentences.chinese: 你們墨家從來都是這麼理智的嗎？

sentences.english: It's the excavation and representation of Mohists' spirit of chivalry that concealed in the folk.
sentences.chinese: 這是暗藏於民間的墨家俠義精神的發掘與再現。

sentences.english: At last, there have the Mohist school logic unique inference form in "Jing xia".
sentences.chinese: 最後，《經下》中存在着墨家邏輯豐富的推理形式。

sentences.english: In the process of its development, Wushu has been displaying the Mohist Ideology.
sentences.chinese: 武術在發展過程中對墨家思想有一定的繼承。

sentences.english: After the Han Dynasty, Mohism fell into oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 墨家在漢代以後湮沒無聞。

sentences.english: Modern Neo-Mohism is a academic faction arising freshly.
sentences.chinese: 現代新墨家是新近出現的一個學術派別。

sentences.english: The Mohism is with the survival or perish of Mojia organism all the time.
sentences.chinese: 墨學興衰是與墨家組織的存亡相始終的。

sentences.english: The Mohists' concept of morals and benefits differ from the pre Qin Philosophers'.
sentences.chinese: 墨家義利觀與先秦諸子有所不同。

sentences.english: Mohism thoughts in Pre Qin Dynasty involved abundant thoughts on HR management.
sentences.chinese: 先秦墨家思想中包含着豐富的人力資源管理心理思想。

definition: School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Zou Yan 鄒衍|邹衍[Zou1 Yan3]

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
original name of Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3]
Mohist/follower of Mohist school
School of Diplomacy of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) whose leading advocates were Su Qin 蘇秦|苏秦[Su1 Qin2] and Zhang Yi 張儀|张仪[Zhang4 Yi2]
Han Fei, also known as Han Feizi 韓非子|韩非子[Han2 Fei1 zi3] (c. 280-233 BC), Legalist philosopher of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)
tycoon/magnate
"universal love", principle advocated by Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3], stressing that people should care for everyone equally
Han Feizi, book of Legalist Philosophy authored by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Su Qin (340-284 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
two-character surname Gongsun
military strategist in ancient China/military commander/soldier
the School of the Military, one of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1] of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
